#summary add_field - adds a field to a string-delimited log file.

= Usage =

`add_field <options> [file ...]`

 * if no "label" is provided, the "value" will be used.
 * for -f, a value of either 0 or 1 may be used to indicate the first position.
 * for -f, a value of -1 indicates that the field should be appended to each line.
 * if both -v and -c are specified, -c takes precedence.


= Options =
||*Short Opt*||*Long Opt*||*Argument*||*Description*||
||-h||--help|| ||print this message and exit||
||-d||--delim||<delim> ||field separator string (default: 0xfe)||
||-f||--field||<field> ||the 1-based index for the new field (default: 1)||
||-l||--label||<label> ||specifies the first-line label for the new field||
||-v||--value||<value> ||the value to place in the new field (default: emtpy)||
||-c||--copy||<copy> ||specifies an existing field to copy into the new field||
